name: Mango Sticky Rice
instructions: 1. Soak the sticky rice in water for at least 4 hours or overnight.
2. Drain the soaked rice and steam it for about 20 minutes, until the grains are tender.
3. In a saucepan, heat the coconut milk over medium heat. Add sugar and salt, and stir until dissolved.
4. Pour half of the coconut milk mixture over the steamed sticky rice and let it sit for 15 minutes to allow the rice to absorb the flavors.
5. While the rice is absorbing the coconut milk mixture, peel and slice the mango into thin strips or bite-sized pieces.
6. Serve the sticky rice on a plate or bowl and top it with the sliced mango.
7. Drizzle the remaining coconut milk mixture on top of the mango and rice.
8. Optional: Sprinkle some sesame seeds over the dish for garnish.
description: Mango Sticky Rice is a popular Thai dessert that combines the sweetness of ripe mangoes with the creamy, sticky texture of glutinous rice. The dish is made by steaming the sticky rice and then serving it with sliced mango and a sweet coconut milk sauce. It is a refreshing and delicious treat perfect for summertime or any time you're craving a tropical dessert.
